books.title: The Murder on the Links
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A famous Belgian detective and his sidekick are summoned to France to investigate the mysterious murder of a rich businessman.

books.title: Kim
books.author: Rudyard Kipling
books.summary: An orphaned street-urchin follows a holy man across India during the time of the British Raj, eventually gaining an education and becoming a recruit to the Great Game of espionage against the Russians.

books.title: Struggles and Triumphs
books.author: P. T. Barnum
books.summary: The world’s greatest showman tells the story of his life.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: The Prince and the Pauper
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: The Prince of England and a pauper find their identities switched.

books.title: Love Among the Chickens
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Stanley Ukridge ensnares the narrator in another one of his schemes: running a chicken farm in the English countryside.

books.title: The Libation Bearers
books.author: Aeschylus
books.summary: A man is ordered by a god to avenge his father’s murder by killing his mother and her lover.

books.title: Figures of Earth
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: A young swineherd rises to the rank of Count by following his own thinking and desires.

books.title: Yama
books.author: Aleksandr Kuprin
books.summary: An account of the lives of a group of prostitutes in a brothel in southern Russia.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: An ancient undead monster terrorizes Victorian London.

books.title: My Disillusionment in Russia
books.author: Emma Goldman
books.summary: Emma Goldman recounts her experiences living in the early Soviet Union.

books.title: The Patient in Room 18
books.author: Mignon G. Eberhart
books.summary: A nurse helps a detective investigate a murder in a hospital.

books.title: How the Other Half Lives
books.author: Jacob Riis
books.summary: A social reformer documents the living conditions of the poor in the tenements of New York City.

books.title: Nicomachean Ethics
books.author: Aristotle
books.summary: Aristotle examines how one may live in the most thriving, excellent manner.

books.title: Verses on Various Occasions
books.author: John Henry Newman
books.summary: A collection of poems by John Henry Newman.

books.title: The Little Nugget
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: The ambitious fiancée of an English gentleman asks him to kidnap the son of an American businessman from boarding school, before professional kidnappers get to him first.

books.title: The First Men in the Moon
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: Two British men become the first humans to reach the Moon.

books.title: School Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s school stories about the lives and adventures of schoolboys in the early 1900s.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: Two Years Before the Mast
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A Harvard student embarks on a two-year voyage as a sailor aboard a merchant ship, exposing the harsh conditions of life at sea in the 19th century.
